metadata.description: Complex passwords can reduce the likelihood of success of automated password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: Make sure no accounts have blank (null) passwords.

metadata.title: The operating system must be a supported release.
metadata.description: An operating system release is considered supported if the vendor continues to provide security patches for the product. With an unsupported release, it will not be possible to resolve security issues discovered in the system software.

criterion.comment: Installed operating system's name is SunOS
Installed operating system is release 5.11

metadata.title: The system must require users to re-authenticate to unlock a graphical desktop environment.
metadata.description: Allowing access to a graphical environment when the user is not attending the system can allow unauthorized users access to the system.

extend_definition.comment: Pass if XWindows is not in use.

criterion.comment: XScreenSaver must have a timeout of 15 minutes.
XScreenSaver must have a lockTimeout of 0:00:05.
XScreenSaver must have a lock field set to true.
Each user's .xscreensaver must have a lock field set to true.
Each user's .xscreensaver must have a lockTimeout of 5 seconds.
Each user's .xscreensaver must have a timeout of 15 minutes.

metadata.title: All .Xauthority files must have mode 0600 or less permissive.
metadata.description: All .Xauthority files ensure the user is authorized to access the specific X Windows host. Excessive permissions may permit unauthorized modification.Xauthority files ensure that the user is authorized to access that specific X Windows host. Excessive permissions may permit unauthorized modification of these files, which could lead to denial of service to authorized access or allow unauthorized access to be obtained.

extend_definition.comment: Pass if XWindows is not in use.
.Xauthority files for each user must be 0600 or less permissive.

metadata.title: The system must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.
metadata.description: The use of common words in passwords simplifies password-cracking attacks.

criterion.comment: Check in /etc/default/passwd that DICTIONLIST is set to /usr/share/lib/dict/words.
Check in /etc/default/passwd that DICTIONDBDIR is set to /var/passwd.
Check to make sure that /usr/share/lib/dict/words exists and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.hwm exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.pwd exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.pwi exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that authtok_check.lock exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR.

metadata.title: The system must restrict the ability of users to assume excessive privileges to members of a defined group and prevent unauthorized users from accessing administrative tools.
metadata.description: Allowing any user to elevate their privileges can allow them excessive control of the system tools.

criterion.comment: Root must be configured as a role.
At least one local user must be assigned the root role.

metadata.title: The default umask for system and users must be 077.
metadata.description: Setting a very secure default value for umask ensures that users make a conscious choice about their file permissions.

criterion.comment: Check the umask setting in every user initialization file to make sure it is 077.
Check the umask setting in the default login file to make sure it is 077.
Check each user account to make sure each has a .profile user initialization file.

metadata.title: The system must not allow users to configure .forward files.
metadata.description: Use of the .forward file poses a security risk in that sensitive data may be inadvertently transferred outside the organization. The .forward file also poses a secondary risk as it can be used to execute commands that may perform unintended actions.

criterion.comment: no user .forward files exist

metadata.title: User .netrc files must not exist.
metadata.description: The .netrc file presents a significant security risk since it stores passwords in unencrypted form.

criterion.comment: .netrc files do not exist

metadata.title: The default umask for FTP users must be 077.
metadata.description: Setting a very secure default value for umask ensures that users make a conscious choice about their file permissions.

criterion.comment: Check to see if the FTP service is listed under the SMF.
FTP umask value must be set to 077.

metadata.title: SOL-11.1-070130 - Reserved UIDs 0-99 must only be used by system accounts.
metadata.description: If a user is assigned a UID that is in the reserved range, even if it is not presently in use, security exposures can arise if a subsequently installed application uses the same UID.

criteria.comment: IF 11.3 or less THEN check old userids ELSE check 11.4 userids
IF 11.3 or less THEN check old userids

criterion.comment: 11.3 or less?
accounts with reserved UIDs match known system accounts

criteria.comment: IF 11.4 or newer THEN check new userids

criterion.comment: 11.4 or newer?
accounts with reserved UIDs match known system accounts

metadata.title: Login services for serial ports must be disabled.
metadata.description: Login services should not be enabled on any serial ports that are not strictly required to support the mission of the system. This action can be safely performed even when console access is provided using a serial port.

criterion.comment: svc:/system/console-login:terma is disabled
svc:/system/console-login:termb is disabled

metadata.title: The nobody access for RPC encryption key storage service must be disabled.
metadata.description: If login by the user "nobody" is allowed for secure RPC, there is an increased risk of system compromise. If keyserv holds a private key for the "nobody" user, it will be used by key_encryptsession to compute a magic phrase which can be easily recovered by a malicious user.

criterion.comment: Check to see that nobody keys are disabled.

metadata.title: X11 forwarding for SSH must be disabled.
metadata.description: As enabling X11 Forwarding on the host can permit a malicious user to secretly open another X11 connection to another remote client during the session and perform unobtrusive activities such as keystroke monitoring, if the X11 services are not required for the system's intended function, they should be disabled or restricted as appropriate to the user's needs.

criterion.comment: X11Forwarding must be set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: Consecutive login attempts for SSH must be limited to 3.
metadata.description: Determine if consecutive login attempts are limited to 3.

criteria.comment: The system must disconnect and force a reconnect after 3 failed login attempts.

criterion.comment: MaxAuthTries is set to 6 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
MaxAuthTriesLog is set to 6 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: The rhost-based authentication for SSH must be diabled.
metadata.description: Setting this parameter forces users to enter a password with SSH.

criterion.comment: IgnoreRhosts is unset or set to yes in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: Direct root account login must not be permitted for SSH access.
metadata.description: The system should not allow users to log in as the root user directly, as audited actions would be non-attributable to a specific user.

criterion.comment: PermitRootLogin is set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: Login must not be permitted with empty/null passwords for SSH.
metadata.description: Permitting login without a password is inherently risky.

criterion.comment: PermitEmptyPasswords is set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: The operating system must terminate all sessions and network connections when non-local maintenance is completed.
metadata.description: Determines if SSH is configured to disconnect sessions after 10 minutes of inactivity.

criteria.comment: The system is configured to disconnect SSH after 10 minutes of inactivity.

criterion.comment: ClientAliveInterval is set to 600 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
ClientAliveCountMax is set to 0 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: The .rhosts file must not be supported in PAM.
metadata.description: .rhosts files are used to specify a list of hosts that are permitted remote access to a particular account without authenticating. The use of such a mechanism defeats strong identification and authentication requirements.

criterion.comment: No files in /etc/pam.d contain the line pam_rhosts_auth.so.1.
/etc/pam.conf does not contain the line pam_rhosts_auth.so.1.

metadata.title: Groups assigned to users must exist in the /etc/group file.
metadata.description: Groups defined in passwd but not in group file pose a threat to system security since group permissions are not properly managed.

criterion.comment: Groups listed in the /etc/passwd file must exist.

metadata.title: The use of FTP must be restricted.
metadata.description: FTP is an insecure protocol that transfers files and credentials in clear text, and can be replaced by using SFTP. However, if FTP is permitted for use in the environment, it is important to ensure that the default "system" accounts are not permitted to transfer files via FTP, especially the root role. Consider also adding the names of other privileged or shared accounts that may exist on the system such as user "oracle" and the account which the web server process runs under.

criterion.comment: Check to see if the FTP service is listed under the SMF.
ftpusers contains aiuser
ftpusers contains noaccess
ftpusers contains nobody
ftpusers contains nobody4
ftpusers contains all system users

metadata.title: User .rhosts files must not exist.
metadata.description: Even though the .rhosts files are ineffective if support is disabled in /etc/pam.conf, they may have been brought over from other systems and could contain information useful to an attacker for those other systems.

criterion.comment: .rhosts files do not exist

metadata.title: The system must not allow autologin capabilities from the GNOME desktop.
metadata.description: As automatic logins are a known security risk for other than "kiosk" types of systems, GNOME automatic login should be disabled in pam.conf.

criterion.comment: /etc/pam.d/gdm-autologin contains no auth or account entries

metadata.title: Permissions on user .netrc files must be 750 or less permissive.
metadata.description: .netrc files may contain unencrypted passwords that can be used to attack other systems.

criterion.comment: .netrc files are 750 or less permissive

metadata.title: The operating system, upon successful logon, must display to the user the date and time of the last logon (access).
metadata.description: Specifies whether sshd should print the date and time of the last user login when a user logs in interactively. The default is "yes".

criterion.comment: Check "PrintLastLog" is set to "yes" or nonexistent in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: Permissions on user home directories must be 750 or less permissive.
metadata.description: Group-writable or world-writable user home directories may enable malicious users to steal or modify other users' data or to gain another user's system privileges.

criterion.comment: user home directory permissions are 750 or less permissive

metadata.title: The operating system session lock mechanism, when activated on a device with a display screen, must place a publicly viewable pattern onto the associated display, hiding what was previously visible on the screen.
metadata.description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence.

extend_definition.comment: Pass if XWindows is not in use.

criterion.comment: The XScreenSaver file must list blank as the mode.
All user .xscreensaver files must list blank as the mode.

metadata.title: The operating system must not allow logins for users with blank passwords.
metadata.description: If the password field is blank and the system does not enforce a policy that passwords are required, it could allow login without proper authentication of a user.

criterion.comment: PASSREQ line in /etc/default/login.

metadata.title: Systems must employ cryptographic hashes for passwords using the SHA-2 family of algorithms or FIPS 140-2 approved successors.
metadata.description: Cryptographic hashes provide quick password authentication while not actually storing the password.

criteria.comment: The password hashes stored on the system must have been generated using a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm.

criterion.comment: CRYPT_DEFAULT is set to 6
CRYPT_ALGORITHMS_ALLOW is set to 5,6

metadata.title: The limitpriv zone option must be set to the vendor default or less permissive.
metadata.description: Solaris zones can be assigned privileges generally reserved for the global zone using the "limitpriv" zone option. Any privilege assignments in excess of the vendor defaults may provide the ability for a non-global zone to compromise the global zone.

extend_definition.comment: pass if not a global zone

criterion.comment: Make sure that all the different zones on the system have their limitpriv attribute set to default.

metadata.title: Solaris Global Zone
metadata.description: The system is a Solaris Global Zone

criterion.comment: /etc/zones/index does not exist
/etc/zones/index contains global

metadata.title: Auditing enabled or not global zone
metadata.description: Audit service is running or not in a global zone.

criterion.comment: auditd is online

metadata.title: Users must have a valid home directory assignment.
metadata.description: All users must be assigned a home directory in the passwd file. Failure to have a home directory may result in the user being put in the root directory.

criterion.comment: user home directory assignments are not blank

metadata.title: All system start-up files must be owned by root.
metadata.description: System start-up files not owned by root could lead to system compromise by allowing malicious users or applications to modify them for unauthorized purposes. This could lead to system and network compromise.

criterion.comment: All files under /etc/rc* and init.d directories are owned by root

metadata.title: The operating system must reveal error messages only to authorized personnel.
metadata.description: Proper file permissions and ownership ensures that only designated personnel in the organization can access error messages.

criterion.comment: The /var/adm/messages file must be owned by Root and of the Root group. Also, the file permissions must be 640.
The /var/adm folder must be owned by Root and of the System group. Also, the file permissions must be 750.

metadata.title: The operating system must monitor for unauthorized connections of mobile devices to organizational information systems.
metadata.description: Mobile devices include portable storage media (e.g., USB memory sticks, external hard disk drives) and portable computing and communications devices with information storage capability (e.g., notebook/laptop computers, personal digital assistants, cellular telephones, digital cameras, audio recording devices).

extend_definition.comment: pass if not a global zone

criterion.comment: Determine if USB mass storage devices are locked out by the kernel in /etc/system.
Determine if USB mass storage devices are locked out by the kernel in /etc/system.d/*.

metadata.title: All run control scripts must have mode 0755 or less permissive.
metadata.description: If the startup files are writable by other users, these users could modify the startup files to insert malicious commands into the startup files.

criterion.comment: All files under /etc/rc* directories must have file permissions of 0755 or less.
All files under the /lib/svc/method directory must have file permissions of 0755 or less.

metadata.title: The system must prevent the root account from directly logging in except from the system console.
metadata.description: Limiting the root account direct logins to only system consoles protects the root account from direct unauthorized access from a non-console device.

criteria.comment: non-global zone, or CONSOLE configured correctly

criterion.comment: /etc/default/login CONSOLE=/dev/console

metadata.title: All system start-up files must be group-owned by root, sys, or bin.
metadata.description: If system start-up files do not have a group owner of root or a system group, the files may be modified by malicious users or intruders.

criterion.comment: All files under /etc/rc* and init.d directories have group owner root, sys, or bin

metadata.title: The root account must be the only account with GID of 0.
metadata.description: All accounts with a GID of 0 have root group privileges and must be limited to the group account only.

criterion.comment: The root account must be the only account with GID of 0.
GID 0 must only be assigned to root.

metadata.title: The system must disable accounts after three consecutive unsuccessful login attempts.
metadata.description: Allowing continued access to accounts on the system exposes them to brute-force password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: LOCK_AFTER_RETRIES == YES in /etc/security/policy.conf
RETRIES <= 3 in /etc/default/login
lock_after_retries != no in /etc/user_attr

metadata.title: Solaris 11 XWindows Check.
metadata.description: XWindows is being run by the system, using CDM or XDM as a proxy.

criterion.comment: Check to see if CDM is being run by the system.
Check to see if XDM is being run by the system.

metadata.title: Solaris 11.4 Global Zone
metadata.description: The system is a Solaris 11.4 Global Zone

criterion.comment: /var/share/zones/index.json does not exist
/var/share/zones/index.json does not contain 'path:/'

metadata.title: Solaris 11 Global Zone
metadata.description: The system is a Solaris 11 Global Zone

criteria.comment: If OS version is less than 11.4, THEN do the old global zone check, ELSE do the new global zone check

criterion.comment: OS version is less than 11.4
OS version is not less than 11.4
